subBullets.content: Relevant Courses: Intro to Computer Systems, Intro to Software Engineering, Intro to Discrete Structures and Probability, Accelerated Intro to CS, Linear Algebra, Honors Statistical Inference I, Honors Multivariable Calculus

bullets.content: Graduated salutatorian (2 out of ~450 people) in the class of 2017
Rebuilt the front-end of an internal tool used by ~4,000 representatives (~20,000 registered)

subBullets.content: Created a separate tool with Vue.js to check and display a representative's authorization

bullets.content: Worked on a full stack data retrieval web app for the team's fine-grained authorization database

subBullets.content: Sped up an existing Selenium task used to check if applications are down by ~120x by moving it to a Spring Boot service and implementing threads
Converted the team’s central dashboard of URLs to a JSON, enabling the team to automate data retrieval

bullets.content: Led a team of three to build & deploy a web platform for student-written articles and interactive data visualizations
Created an article management system w/ Django & PostgreSQL, designed the UI, and deployed w/ AWS

items.title: American Computer Science League All-Star Finalist

bullets.content: Invited to participate in the All-Star Contest, a national competition for top scoring teams

items.title: American Regional Mathematics League Team High Scorer

bullets.content: Earned a medal for most points scored on the New Hampshire state team at ARML 2016, a national mathematics tournament
Earned a trophy for second highest scoring junior in the state, fourth highest scorer as a senior
Earned after scoring 5 out of 5 on 10 AP exams.
Received a scholarship for the highest achievement of mathematics within the graduating class

items.title: Recipient of the Charles E. Austin Memorial Scholarship and Ralph J. and Alice F. Burns Scholarship

bullets.content: Received two scholarships for high academic achievement through a four year high school career
Designed curriculum and taught computer science at Dr. Earl F. Calcutt Middle School
Led ~50 members of the Nashua North chapter of Mu Alpha Theta, the national math honor society
Organized the school’s tutoring center and connected students who needed extra math help with members
Awarded All-Area Team (12), Nashua North Defensive Player of the Year (12), center back on top 10 defense in NH (goals allowed)
10th place, 55m hurdles at 2017 NHIAA State Division I Indoor Track & Field Championship
